data.title: Fun Atmosphere and Good Food
data.text: Went on a Saturday night with friends and had a short wait. Everyone was very pleasant and helpful. Our server was very polite and attentive and made very good food and drink recommendations. Everyone enjoyed the food and the atmosphere. I had the crab cake and it was wonderful. If you have room after your meal you must try their Sinful Flourless Chocolate Cake. It is melt in your mouth good! Cheers.

data.title: Creative menu, but lacking in flavor
data.text: We chose this restaurant after looking at the menu online and deciding this place had enough variety (in choices AND prices) for a few of us. We actually opted for several appetizers to share - none of which we had ever had before - but agreed that all were lacking in flavor.  For example, both the crab-avocado appetizer and the fried avocado could have used just a twist of lemon or lime to add a bit of flavor (even on the side of the dishes).  Both were very good (in taste and portion size) and creative offerings, but just had no flavor.  It's a nice place with a casual atmosphere with a varied menu - and I'd definitely go back again.

data.title: This place is really good
data.text: Atmosphere is really on point.  The service is attentive and the place is clean.  But this is a restaurant that prides itself on good food and the food is very, very good here.

data.title: Tuesday Taco Night
data.text: Taco Tuesday was pretty good. Just dined here last night. I got the taco special which was 3 tacos for $12 and then we got a Salmon Spinach salad. They brought us warm rolls while we waited for our food. Both dishes were good. We decided to go here because we got a SpotLuck offer. If you haven't tried SpotLuck, it's an app that you download for your phone that you can spin for discounts at local restaurants. Download the app and use promo code MIS5049.

data.title: Great burgers
data.text: Always good food and good service.  Neat old building in the heart of downtown.  I  usually get a burger.   Not an extensive menu.  But, everything on the menu is delicious.

data.title: Cosy atmosphere, pleasant unhurried service, good food
data.text:
Enjoyed a very good dinner.  Only the bacon wrapped duck was a disappointment because it was too spicy for duck, which has a delicate flavor that was lost. Otherwise all the entrees were very good. We sampled the caesar salad, burger, and gnocchi.  All very good.  The desserts were also very rich and delicious.  
i also enjoyed the atmosphere. The old storefront, exposed brink with high ceilings made for a cosy dining room, and the large front window adds a city feel.  I would return and whole heartedly recommend this for a date, or group or family to enjoy.

data.title: Great service and food
data.text: I had lunch with my parents and the waiter was very knowledgeable about their beers and got my dad the perfect beer in a perfect size glass! I really enjoyed my crab cake sandwich and sweet potato fries. This was my 3rd visit, and is was all good again.

data.title: Fun, Friendly
data.text: We stopped in here for a light dinner and drinks. We sat at the bar and the bartenders were very friendly and we enjoyed ourselves! Its a quaint restaurant in historic  Frederick. We'll go back!

data.title: Late night after a concert
data.text: My husband and I needed somewhere fun to go for late night food and drinks.  We could not have made a better choice.  There was live music which was fantastic and the late night menu was great!  Really enjoyed our visit.

user_location.name: Rocky Mount, North Carolina, United States

data.title: Good menu, decent food
data.text: We visited JoJo's during the last night of our vacation in Maryland a few weeks ago. We made a reservation in advance and were seated immediately (this was a Friday night and it was pretty quiet when we walked in, so we probably didn't need a reservation). Our server quickly took our drink and appetizer orders. We ordered one of their "special" appetizers, chicken egg rolls, and they were delicious! But things quickly went downhill for us. As I was eating my app and enjoying my cocktail, I noticed a dead fly in the bottom of my glass! Not very appetizing and we immediately sent the drink back. The waiter apologized and brought another drink. Our dinners followed and both were just okay. We ordered the fish and chips (they were pretty bland) and the fish tacos (which did not include a lot of fish). Unfortunately, we were pretty disappointed by our meals and were even more disappointed when our server brought our bill and we saw that they did not comp my drink. All of this left a bad taste in our mouths and we will not return if we should find ourselves back in the area.

data.title: Eclectic fare
data.text: We found this restaurant through some who works at the Museum of Civil War Medicine.  We had and early dinner and sat at the front window so we could people watch.  One of us had the fabulous seafood pasta and one of us had the "just okay crab cake with shredded Brussels sprouts and mashed potatoes (served lukewarm not hot). Service was attentive and friendly.  The menu had a broad price range (from $12.00 to $30.00 plus).  Wine selection by the bottle was good but by the glass less so. The restaurant is located on the boutiquey Patrick street.

data.title: Succulent crab cakes.....the real deal.
data.text: Have eaten lunch and dinner there on several occasions, so far so good!  My husbands choice for downtown.  Crab cakes and ceasar salads are very tasty. Fresh with hunks of crabmeat. Service is good.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Stopped in here for a late lunch. Delicious! My husband had brisket and I had spinach cob salad. Our fiends chicken Hawaii style sandwich and lettuce wraps. All the food was sumptuous and plenty of it! Went away with filled tummys but not overly so. I would definitely go back!

data.title: Served our large group
data.text: We had a wedding rehearsal dinner with about 30 people and several separate checks. They seated us in a large room in the back. The servers were friendly and attentive. They didn't seem to mind that we had separate checks. The food was delicious and was served timely. The atmosphere was pleasant. Public parking wasn't far. There was some street parking. The restaurant was located in a pretty section of old Frederick. There were some vegetarian options.

data.title: Excellent meal
data.text: I had chicken parm which was cooked perfectly. The crust was so what crunchy, the sauce was delicious and there were 2 portions on the plate!  Pasta was al denote ad the spinach was cooked with just the right amount of garlic. Save room for dessert.

data.title: Good brunch
data.text: A group of us went here for brunch on the recommendation of my sister, and had a really nice time. It's got a nice look in the old part of Frederick, which already makes it better than typical chain restaurants. They had a great variety on their menu, everything from egg dishes, to waffles and lunch type sandwiches like a po-boy. And even had a kids menu. The food was very good and fresh tasting, they have a chef based menu as opposed to just turning out the basics. The Spicy Bloody Marys are good too. The best part is that they were also quite affordable, a nice bonus.

data.title: Gal Pal Lunch
data.text:
A girlfriend and I had lunch here. It's a bit pricy but it has a nice. Vibe, the waiter was very knowledgable about the menue and the food was fresh.
I had the Korean ,entice wrap with chicken. The chicken was tender and the marinade, dressing was lite.
My friend had a sandwich with turkey and avacado with a dressing that she said had a nice tangy flavor.
We shared a piece of chocolate sin cake, it was like eating fudge! Very dense and chocolaty.

data.title: Simple Food that Excites
data.text: Stoped in this place on a whim.  What a great unexpected find.  The food and service were outstanding.  I had the pulled pork belly with slaw on a brioche bun.  It was a a great sandwich, seasoned perfectly.  The pork metled in my mouth.  The fries are worth an honorable mention.  I really wanted to top it off with desert, but I was full.  I also had an appetizer which was great.

data.title: Great lunch at JoJo's
data.text: There are so many restaurants in Frederick but we had lunch at JoJo's and were very happy we stopped there.   The food was delicious and the service was excellent.  Ben was very helpful in explaining the many beers that were available.  We will definitely return.

data.title: A tad pricey, but tasty and quiet
data.text: We recently had brunch at JoJo's (two times in 3 weeks). The service is upscale, but not stuffy and the brunch menu is nicely eclectic. If calamari is on the menu when you are there, order it for sure!
